meta.name: EzMart Dashboard Design System
meta.intent: Complete design language and component guidelines enabling AI to precisely recreate this dashboard aesthetic in Next.js/Tailwind projects.
meta.tone: Clean, optimistic, data-rich ecommerce admin with warm neutrals and bold accent orange.
meta.designPhilosophy: Information-first dashboard that balances density with clarity. Uses warm, approachable neutrals to reduce cognitive load while maintaining professional credibility. Orange accent provides energy and draws attention to actionable items and positive metrics.

layout.description: Dashboard uses a fixed left sidebar with scrollable main content area. The warm beige background (#F5E7D8) creates a soft, welcoming canvas that reduces eye strain during extended use.

color.description: Warm neutral canvas with vibrant orange as the primary action color. The palette creates a friendly, energetic atmosphere while maintaining professional credibility. Use high contrast sparinglyâ€”only for critical metrics and primary CTAs.

usage.primary: Use #FF8A1F for primary CTAs, active navigation states, key trend indicators, and chart primary series. Never use on large surfacesâ€”reserve for emphasis.
usage.neutrals: Body text uses #111827 for headings and #4B5563 for body. Secondary text and labels use #6B7280. Avoid pure black.
usage.semantic: Green for positive metrics/changes (+8.09%, success states), red for negative changes, blue for informational pills, gray for neutral/pending.
usage.backgrounds: Main canvas is #F5E7D8. All cards are pure white. Table headers and subtle surfaces use #F9FAFB.
usage.charts: Primary series in orange gradients, secondary in muted orange/peach tones, tertiary in purple/blue. Keep chart backgrounds transparent or very subtle.

typography.description: Clean, highly readable type system optimized for data-dense interfaces. Uses system fonts for performance and native feel.

rules.hierarchy: Use size and weight to establish clear hierarchy. Primary metrics are 28-36px bold, supporting text is 12-14px regular.
rules.numbers: Large metrics use bold weight with tight line-height. Apply tabular-nums for aligned columns in tables.
rules.labels: Uppercase labels with increased letter-spacing (0.06em) for table headers and section tags. Use 11-12px size.
rules.readability: Body text is never smaller than 14px. Line-height is 1.4-1.6 for optimal readability. Maintain strong contrast ratios (4.5:1 minimum).
rules.consistency: Sidebar nav uses 14px medium weight. Active states use same size but heavier weight or color change, not both.

spacing.description: Consistent 4px-based spacing system creates predictable rhythm and alignment across all components.

principles.consistency: Always use values from the scale. Never use arbitrary values like 15px or 23px.
principles.rhythm: Maintain consistent vertical rhythm using 24px as the baseline grid for stacking components.
principles.density: Dense layouts (tables, lists) use 12-16px vertical spacing. Relaxed layouts (cards, forms) use 20-24px.
principles.breathing: Cards always have minimum 20px internal padding. Never let content touch card edges.

radii.description: Rounded corners create friendly, modern aesthetic. Larger elements get larger radii.

usage.cards: xl (16px) for standard cards, 2xl (20px) for hero cards
usage.buttons: full (9999px) for pill buttons, lg (14px) for rectangular buttons
usage.inputs: full (9999px) for search bars, lg (14px) for form inputs
usage.images: md (10px) for product thumbnails, lg (14px) for larger images
usage.tables: lg (14px) for table container, none for internal cells

iconography.description: Simple, rounded line icons with 1.5-2px stroke weight. Icons should be functional, not decorative.
iconography.style: Outline/line style with rounded caps and joins. Prefer Lucide, Heroicons, or similar modern icon sets.

principles.consistency: Use same icon set throughout. Never mix different icon styles.
principles.alignment: Vertically center icons with adjacent text. Use 8px gap between icon and text.
principles.semantic: Use consistent icons for actions (search, filter, settings, notifications). Don't vary icons for the same action.
principles.color: Default icon color is #6B7280. Use brand orange for active/selected states. Use semantic colors for status icons.

animation.description: Subtle, fast animations enhance feedback without distracting. All transitions feel instant (<200ms).

principles.performance: Only animate transform and opacity for 60fps. Avoid animating width, height, or layout properties.
principles.purpose: Every animation should provide feedback or guide attention. No gratuitous motion.
principles.subtlety: Micro-interactions are barely noticeable but make the UI feel responsive.
principles.accessibility: Respect prefers-reduced-motion. Disable non-essential animations for users who request it.

dashboardLayout.description: Standard dashboard page layout with metric cards at top, charts in middle, table at bottom.
structure: Top row: 4 metric cards (Total Sales, Total Orders, Total Shipped, Total Returns)
Second row: Large chart card (Revenue Analytics) + Medium card (Monthly Target/Progress)
Third row: Medium chart (Active User) + Medium chart (Conversion Rate) + Medium list (Traffic Sources)
Fourth row: Large table (Recent Orders) + Medium list (Recent Activity)

responsiveness.desktop: 4-column grid for metrics, 2-3 column for charts
responsiveness.tablet: 2-column grid for metrics, 1-2 column for charts

visual: Prioritize data visibility: metrics should be scannable at a glance.
Use the warm beige canvas (#F5E7D8) to reduce eye strain and create welcoming atmosphere.
Reserve orange (#FF8A1F) for primary actions, active states, and key metric highlights only.
Maintain generous whitespace: cards breathe with 24px gaps, never touching edges.
Prefer subtle shadows over heavy borders to create depth.
Use color semantically: green for positive, red for negative, orange for primary, gray for neutral.
interaction: Hover states use background lightening, not borders.
Active states combine background change with subtle scale/shadow changes.
Loading states use skeleton screens in same layout as loaded content.
Error states are inline and contextual, not modal unless critical.
composition: Establish clear hierarchy: metrics > trends > details.
Top row always contains high-level KPIs (4 metric cards).
Middle rows show trends, breakdowns, and comparisons (charts, progress).
Bottom rows contain detailed data (tables, activity logs).
Align related metrics vertically for easy comparison.
Keep card titles consistent in size and position (top-left, 16px/600).
accessibility: Maintain 4.5:1 contrast ratio minimum for all text.
Never use color alone to convey information (combine with icons/text).
All interactive elements have 44px minimum touch target.
Support keyboard navigation with visible focus states.
Provide text alternatives for all charts and graphs.
dataVisualization: Charts use orange as primary color (#FF8A1F) with lighter tints for secondary series.
Grid lines are subtle (#F3F4F6) and don't compete with data.
Always include axis labels and legends.
Use consistent scale across related charts.
Bar charts have rounded corners (8px) for friendliness.
responsive: Mobile-first approach: stack cards vertically on small screens.
Collapse sidebar to hamburger menu below 1024px.
Table cards become scrollable horizontally on mobile.
Chart heights reduce on mobile to preserve readability.
performance: Load critical metrics first (top row cards).
Lazy load charts and tables below fold.
Use skeleton screens during data fetching.
Optimize images: WebP format, responsive sizes.
Virtual scrolling for tables with 100+ rows.
consistency: Use same card structure across dashboard: header (title + action) â†’ content â†’ footer (optional).
Icon + text combinations always use 8px gap.
Status badges use same size (24px height) and style across dashboard.
Maintain typography scale strictly: don't introduce new sizes.
Use spacing scale values only: 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, 32, etc.

componentStates.description: Comprehensive state specifications for all interactive elements.

input.error: Red border, error message below input

card.empty: Empty state icon and message centered

lightweight.usage: Alternative if bundle size is critical

primary.name: lucide-react

alternative.name: react-icons

alternative.pros: Multiple icon sets in one package
